Description: Upper part of terracotta figure of naked squatting woman. The upper part of a fat female being, probably squatting, and naked except for a narrow ribbon passing under her breasts and round under her arms. Her hair is parted in the middle and she wears a large, tightly bound wreath, the ribbons of which fall onto her shoulders; she has ball earrings. The top of her pubic triangle remains, and she holds a phallus in each hand. The back is plain, with the top of a circular vent surviving. Hollow; two-piece mould. Orange-brown Nile silt, with a darker surface and a grey core; a little mica can be seen.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Bibliog. Walters 1903: D 385; Winter 1903 (2): 459, no. 2.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (D385)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Louis, Duc de Blacas d'Aulps
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Louis, Duc de Blacas d'Aulps
